Gary_Bricks,"2011-06-06T12:46:53.25Z","Satisfactory","Mostly dull set. But I find this to be better then the Mini Helicopter set from 2010. Has 38 pieces and came free with a newspaper.

The rotors are stable thanks to the round tile on top. It is missing a back rotor though. Has poor engine details. Mostly yellow with red brick on bottom
",TRUE,4,5,3,4,5

Odeinoichus,"2016-08-01T22:58:30.397Z","Stand Out Polybag from Creator","

Set # 7799 Cargo Copter: Having acquired this polybag recently it’s time to discuss the pros and cons of this set from 2008 to let you know if you should track this down eight years later.

column2: Fun little model design, with interesting build techniques to make a helicopter that is rather thin and unusual in how it looks, above all fun to play with.
Includes 2x4 red brick for cargo container and added play feature.
Overall build and parts use very enjoyable, landing gear design is particularly intriguing.
Piece count is less than 40, making the set a bit pricy when compared to other Polybags.
Design of Helicopter may not be to everyone’s tastes.

column1: LEGO Creator is a great Theme, my exposure to it is really only with Polybags as I prefer them over the larger 2-in-1 and 3-in-1 models. That being said LEGO Creator Polybags are very fun to collect, you can have a large fleet of vehicles in a smaller easier to display and enjoy build. Kids will have something to play with also, that being said the Polybags are a niche market.

Fans of Polybags will enjoy this set, tracking it down may mean paying much more than its original price on the secondary market. So when I recommend a polybag I have to take all of this into consideration. Honestly, if I saw it somewhere for a good price I’d recommend picking it up, don’t overpay for it though.
